#summary Cofiguring OpenWRT to rspro

= Introduction =

How to configure an Basic Openwrt custom firmware to the following device:

  #  Ubitiqui Routerstation pro 680MHZ/4 LAN GIGA/128 MB/3 SLOTS+USB 
  #  Mini-PCI Senao 2,4/5,8GHZ NL-5354MP PLUS ARIES2
  #  Power supply 18V 2000MA 90-240V 18W1820
  #  Cable Pig tail UFL for SMA


= Config =
In OpenWRT's root to access Openwrt configuration do:
{{{Make menuconfig}}}

{{{
Tagert System: Atheros AR71xx/AR7240/AR913x
Target Profile: (Ubiquiti RouterStation Pro)  
}}}

For the wireless Driver go to:
{{{
Kernel modules ---> Wireless Drivers --->
}}}

There you should select:
{{{
kmod-ath5k (Atheros 5xxx wireless card)
kmod-madwifi
}}}
Kmod-ath5k enables kmod-mac80211,kmod-ath and kmod-cfg80211.
Kmod-ath has two options that we anabled:
{{{
 [*] Force Atheros drivers to respect the user's regdomain settings   
 [*] Atheros wireless debugging                                        
}}} 
Kmod-mac80211 has one options that we anabled:
{{{
 [*] Export mac80211 internals in DebugFS
}}}

Select kmod-madwifi package and anable the following option:
{{{
 [*] Combine driver and net80211 into a single module
}}}

For wireless drivers we're done.
Next we can use web interface luci:
Return to main menu and choose:
{{{
  LuCI  -->  Collections  --->  <*> luci 
}}}
Select luci package
